item.description:
Distance: 10.2 miles (minimum)
Elevation Gain: 3,400 feet (minimum)
Book Time: 6 hours, 40 minutes
(not including time for photos, lunch, a visit to AMCs Carter Notch Hut and
exploration of the Carter Lakes)

This rewarding loop hike is classified as strenuous.

Our hiking adventure begins on the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail and then loops up and over Mount Hight and Carter Dome via the Carter Dome and Carter-Moriah Trails. On the trip down from Carter Dome, we will visit a boulder field known as the Rampart. AMCs Carter Notch Hut and the Carter Lakes are located nearby. We will return by heading back down the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trail.

Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Please update any Maybe RSVPs by 12 PM the day before the hike. After that time they will be considered as No RSVPs.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Nineteen-Mile Brook Trailhead.DIRECTIONS: Follow NH Route 16 north through Pinkham Notch. The trailhead parking area is on the right (east) side of the highway exactly 1.0 mile north of the entrance to the Mount Washington Auto Rd.
item.why: Carter Notch boasts some of the finest scenery in the region with overhanging cliffs and stark boulders reflecting in series of beautiful lakes tucked in a secluded hollow.
item.name: Carter Dome, Mount Hight, Carter Notch and the Carter Lakes
